author: potuz
content: Even if this message were appropriate for this server. I'd encourage you to post it as a draft online and then post a link here. Probably r/ethereum will get you more feedback. In particular, governance issues are explicitly deemed off-topic in the server rules outlined in #wellcome

author: charleshe3782
content: I can just delete the governance issues around ETH, or even crypto as a whole, as this is one facet of the critique/skepticism

author: charleshe3782
content:
Honestly, I find it doubtful to get meaningful feedback from /r/Ethereum, the resulting discussion would probably not dissuade anyone skeptical of crypto. 

Part of the reason I post this here because it is interesting if people like <@!301186049323958275> or other talented people who have invested in crypto and ETH have anything to say to counter these critiques.

author: trent_vanepps
content: i would share this as a link to a rough draft, not a wall of text here

author: charleshe3782
content:
OK. I have no further lengthy text.

Will you allow discussion of what exists on this channel here? 

Some people have sent messages pushing back on my points, that are quite measured and constructive, but they said their messages was removed and sent me private messages.

I would be willing to move to another discord or reddit, but it's likely the particular subreddit will not contribute to a workable discussion.

content: <@!420951281910284289> <@!689202975754682371> <@!841522115026092042> <@!425279588009246720> I've submitted a PR to get the Yellow Paper updated to Istanbul (w/o EIP-2200) + Muir Glacier: https://github.com/ethereum/yellowpaper/pull/796. author: halfinney.
content: Hi <@!552133098075193354> , <@!301186049323958275>, just wanted to know how Calaveras devnet is going on? Have we found out any other issues apart from the ones related to the blocks not getting fully packed by Nethermind and Geth?

author: timbeiko
content: Not that I'm aware of

author: halfinney.
content: thanks! are things looking optimistic for next week Ropsten HF? based on the data we have right now and barring any unforeseen bugs

author: timbeiko
content: There is no way we hard fork Ropsten next week

author: timbeiko
content: At best we set a block for a fork this Friday. I think we probably want to set a block ~10 days from Friday so we have time for clients to issue a release and to share an announcement.

author: halfinney.
content: got it. Thanks for the reply!

author: halfinney.
content: btw, do you know from any other channels if it got resolved? I saw someone from Nethermind respond. I didn't see any reply from the Geth team after Karim's last message?
